Course Description: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS COURSE IS TO INTRODUCE STUDENTS TO  ACCOUNTING'S SUB-DISCIPLINES, FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING. IT PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH A BASIC UNDERSTANDING OF THE ROLE OF FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING INFORMATION IN THE DECISIONS OF ALL STAKEHOLDERS. (E.G., STOCKHOLDERS, BANKS, FINANCIAL ANALYSTS, PROSPECTIVE STOCKHOLDERS, MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES). THIS COURSE PROVIDES STUDENTS AN UNDERSTANDING OF (1) THE NATURE OF THE ACCOUNTING FUNCTION, AND (2) HOW THE INFORMATION IN ACCOUNTING REPORTS ARE USED BY ALL STAKEHOLDERS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
OUTCOMES:
ON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO UNDERSTAND AND APPLY:
1. THE FIVE ACTIVITY DIMENSIONS OF ACCOUNTING (THE COLLECTION, RECORDING, ANALYSIS, INTERPRETATION AND REPORTING OF INFORMATION TO DECISION MAKERS FOR (MAINLY) THEIR INVESTMENT DECISIONS), 
2.  THE ISSUES SURROUNDING THE FIVE ACTIVITY DIMENSIONS,
3. THE ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH ACCOUNTING IS PRACTICED, AND 
4. WHAT INFORMATION IS USED IN A NUMBER OF SPECIFIC DECISION SITUATIONS, AND HOW SUCH INFORMATION IS USED IN SUCH DECISION SITUATIONS.
Textbook(s):
HORNGREN'S FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING 
AUTHOR: MILLER-NOBLES, TRACIE L.
ISBN-13: 978-0-13-386629-2 EDITION                LATEST
PUBLISHER: PEARSON
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
